info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 11 at 4:34PM MDT by NWS Grand Junction CO
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Grand Junction CO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Colorado...
San Juan River at Pagosa Springs affecting Archuleta County.
.A large area of heavy rainfall is running off and leading to flooding along the smaller drainages and the mainstem of the San Juan River.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring.
* WHERE...San Juan River at Pagosa Springs.
* WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Water will approach the area around the River Center shopping complex in Pagosa Springs. Inundation of sections of Hermosa Street and low land areas adjacent to the river can be expected.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM MDT Saturday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 PM MDT Saturday was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage to 10.3 feet late this afternoon. It will then rise to 11.5 feet this evening. It will fall to 6.3 feet late Monday morning. It will then rise to 7.2 feet late Tuesday morning. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.2 feet on 06/09/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gjt.
The next statement will be issued Sunday evening at 745 PM MDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY
